column4: My guess is that it will be unremarkable.  What we lack in data path width, we make up for in processor speed.  The processor is not the bottleneck in most systems.  For most people, running email, browsers, office products and the like, even 64 vs 32 bit is not perceptible.
I agree for the most part ...
deitarion,  If I wanted to try kde, is it simply an apt-get away?
my current linux is a kubuntu
